result.execSummary:
The defendant Barry Joe Smith Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $392.00 entered as ordered by the court on 07/13/15 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 05/01/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs received, signed, and filed with court.

Defendant Barry Joe Smith in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 5 months in the House of Correction with credit of 1 day time served, and with Huber Privileges for work and school.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:
*Anger management course and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
*Full time employment and/or school.
*20 hours of community service for a non-profit organization. 
*Written apology to officers to be submitted to agent by 06-19-2015.
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Barry Joe Smith in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing hearing.  Defense counsel unable to appear.  Case adjourned to Br 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Barry Joe Smith in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2051 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for 05-15-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Barry Joe Smith in court with Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales, appearing as a friend of the court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel informs Court that defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.

Indigency hearing proceeded.  Statements by the Defendant.  Based upon review of the Defendant's statements made in court, the Court finds that the Defendant is indigent and does qualify for representation at the County's expense. Court will appoint counsel for Defendant.  The Court appoints Attorney Joel Rosenthal to represent defendant at the rate of $70 per hour;  Attorney Rosenthal NOT present in court. 

Court ordered Defendant to contribute to legal expenses at a rate of  $50 per month commencing June 1, 2015 and the 1st day of every month thereafter until paid in full.  All payments should be made directly to the Clerk of Courts Office.  Court ordered case adjourned for pre-trial conference in Branch 46.  Order Appointing Counsel signed by the Court and filed.  Copies to be mailed to the parties.
Clerk:  jms

15RM019251  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/09/2015
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.

Defendant Barry Joe Smith in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 46  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/13/15 @ 1:30pm
